entry.title: Test Your Knowledge Of Databases
entry.content:
General

  • What do you understand by ‘Database’?
  • Define DBMS.
  • Define RDBMS. How is it different from DBMS?
  • Advantages of DBMS.
  • What is Data Redundancy?
  • What are B-trees?
  • What is database partitioning?
  • What is an Object-Oriented Database Model?
  • What is a hashing technique in a database?
  • What does data independence mean?
  • What is Data Warehousing?
  • What is Data Integrity?

SQL related

  • What is SQL?
  • What is the difference between SQL and MySQL?
  • What are Tables and Fields?
  • What are Constraints in SQL?
  • What is a Primary Key?
  • What is a UNIQUE constraint?
  • What is a Foreign Key?
  • What is a Join? List its different types.
  • What is a Self-Join? Cross-Join?
  • What is an Index? Explain its different types.
  • What is Index hunting?
  • What is the difference between Clustered and Non-clustered index?
  • What is a Query?
  • What is a Subquery? What are its types?
  • What is the SELECT statement?
  • What are some common clauses used with SELECT query in SQL?
  • What are UNION, MINUS and INTERSECT commands?
  • What is Cursor? How to use a Cursor?
  • List the different types of relationships in SQL.
  • What is an Alias in SQL?
  • What is a materialized view?
  • What is Normalization?
  • What is Denormalization?
  • What are the TRUNCATE, DELETE and DROP statements?
  • What is the difference between DROP and TRUNCATE statements?
  • What is the difference between DELETE and TRUNCATE statements?
  • What are Aggregate and Scalar functions?
  • What is User-defined function? What are its various types?
  • What is OLTP?
  • What are the differences between OLTP and OLAP?
  • What is Collation? What are the different types of Collation Sensitivity?
  • What is a Stored Procedure?
  • What is a Recursive Stored Procedure?
  • How to create empty tables with the same structure as another table?
  • What is Pattern Matching in SQL?

In-depth questions

  • What are the advantages and disadvantages of views in a database?
  • What are the various forms/types of Normalization?
  • What are the properties of a transaction?
  • What are the standard SQL commands every SQL developer should know?
  • Can you explain how a RDBMS organizes data into tables and fields?
  • What are triggers? How do you invoke a trigger on demand?
  • How can you identify if a database server is running properly?
  • When does functional dependency become the fully functional dependency?
  • How do you find the total number of records in a table?
  • Name four ways to maintain data integrity within a RDBMS.
  • Define what a DML Compiler is.
  • What’s the most effective way to store and access files in a database?
  • Explain Entity, Entity type and Entity set.
  • What happens when Shared and Exclusive locks are applied on a data item?
  • Provide examples of these commands: DDL, DML, and DCL.
  • What are the differences between Nested Loop, Hash Join and Merge Join?
  • What are some disadvantages of file processing systems?
  • What is data abstraction? Provide an example.
  • How many levels of data abstraction are there? And what do they do?
  • What are the integrity rules in DBMS?
  • Explain ACID properties.
  • How do you test database procedures and triggers?
  • What are the risks of storing a hibernate-managed object in a cache? How do you overcome the problems if there is one?
  • How do ‘View’ and ‘Data Independence’ relate to one another?
  • How do you improve query performance by using Index hunting?

Sources:

  • https://www.interviewbit.com/sql-interview-questions/
  • https://www.indeed.com/career-advice/interviewing/database-interview-questions
  • https://www.softwaretestinghelp.com/database-interview-questions/
  • https://www.guru99.com/database-interview-questions.html
entry.summary: General What do you understand by ‘Database’? Define DBMS. Define RDBMS. How is it different from DBMS? Advantages of DBMS. What is Data Redundancy? What are B-trees? What is database partitioning? What is an Object-Oriented Database Model? What is a hashing technique in a database? What does data independence mean? What is Data Warehousing? What is Data Integrity?
